intro: Rhaphidophora corneri, commonly known as the Congo arrowroot, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a rough texture and prominent veins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically concealed within the spathe. Rhaphidophora corneri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
